column2: The Whale is an 1851 novel by American writer Herman Melville. The book is the sailor Ishmael's narrative of the obsessive quest of Ahab
column3: captain of the whaling ship Pequod
column5: the giant white sperm whale that on the ship's previous voyage bit off Ahab's leg at the knee.<Call me Ishmael. Some years ago—never mind how long precisely—having little or no money in my purse
column6: and nothing particular to interest me on shore
column7: I thought I would sail about a little and see the watery part of the world. It is a way I have of driving off the spleen and regulating the circulation. Whenever I find myself growing grim about the mouth; whenever it is a damp
column8: drizzly November in my soul. whenever I find myself involuntarily pausing before coffin warehouses
column9: and bringing up the rear of every funeral I meet; and especially whenever my hypos get such an upper hand of me
column10: that it requires a strong moral principle to prevent me from deliberately stepping into the street
column11: and methodically knocking people’s hats off—then
column12: I account it high time to get to sea as soon as I can. This is my substitute for pistol and ball. With a philosophical flourish Cato throws himself upon his sword. I quietly take to the ship. There is nothing surprising in this. If they but knew it
column13: almost all men in their degree
column15: cherish very nearly the same feelings towards the ocean with me. "
